Reviews.Title: “the worst place in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jacob r
Reviews.Content: people of hotel booked the same room twice, they would want to chance us of hotel to anywhere place, but they never wanted refund the money. staff were not friendly were rude, place are dirty and expensive. it was a very bad experience. "Imagine more than 100 euros per night and they want to take the hotel" huye de este lugar

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in before 1 PM”
Reviews.Author: NoelPeek
Reviews.Content: My flight came in at 5:15 AM, which was a bit problematic because I was told I could not check in until 1 PM. However, the staff did let me leave my bags there and let me check in a bit early. Stayed in an 10 person dorm, pretty standard hostel. Sink in the room, and only one shower/toilet for all of us but it wasn't really a problem. The kitchen is decent, and the free breakfast consists of cereal, juice/tea/coffee, and bread with jam/peanut butter/nutella/cheese spread. Internet cuts out a lot but WiFi is free, and there are also 2 computers for guest use. The location is in the museum district, and a bit of a walk to get to the red light district and the majority of the touristic spots. If you don't mind walking for extended periods of time, or paying the 2.70 euros for the tram, it's not bad. I'd probably stay here again if I could get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hostel, good value”
Reviews.Author: tdhorne
Reviews.Content: Hotel Annemarie is a nice, clean Hostel. Located just off a main tram line from the Central Station, it is within walking distance to museums and other attractions and a short tram ride to the entertainment district and the central area (though Amsterdam is not a large city and you can walk the entire city easily, I'd been hiking quite a bit beforehand and was feeling a bit lazy). Very friendly staff and clean beds. Beds were a bit on the thin side, but I slept fine. En suite bath and the dorm I was in had a balcony. Quiet area so you can get a good nights sleep after a long day of seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, average location”
Reviews.Author: cabsBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My four friends and I booked this hostel. We paid extra to have a 6 person room to ourselves. Manager was unfriendly and unhelpful when we arrived. Would not let 2 of us book in without paying the whole 3 days in cash up front. Had to walk around the corner and make 3 ATM withdrawals to come up with the 600 euro required to avoid having to wait for our other friends (who were on later flights) before dropping off bags. On 2 occasions employees walked directly into room using their own key without knocking. The second time was at 9.45 am on our last morning to start allocating bunks for new guests as two of our friends were staying an extra night. The location is also pretty average. It's down near the museum district and you have to catch trams to get into ledesplein, dam square or central station. I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Carito21
Reviews.Content: I was in England and I booked one room for go to Amsterdam on my holidays... Unfortunately I couldn't go because of my work. I called for cancel the room I had booked. Let me tell you that the manager of this "hotel" was the most rude person I had ever talk. He doesn't give me any solution and also they charged 100% of the price for no show!!... They stolen me 200 GBP from my account!! Never book or go there!!.. Sure you will have best options!

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Backpacker14542
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this HOSTEL before leaving for Amsterdam due to the bad reviews listed on this site. As i only found this site after booking. I don't know what all the fuss is about. We arrived to a great welcome, the rooms although not amazing are fine for the purpose. We stayed in the cheapest 12 person room in the place and found it fine. The only reason i can fashion for all the bad reviews is that due to the name of the HOSTEL being 'Hotel AnneMarie'. People booking or walking in are expecting a hotel but are met with a HOSTEL. I cannot stress more that this is a HOSTEL and not a hotel. Perfect location to shops, museums, coffeeshops, supermarket and opposite a huge concert hall. The staff were always helpful and kind. They let us leave our bags there for the last day as our flight wasn't until the evening. Breakfast was basic but good. I would recommend this HOSTEL to anyone looking for a HOSTEL. If your looking for a hotel go to a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unfriendly hostel”
Reviews.Author: Manicat
Reviews.Content: The guy who owns this hostel is rude and angry and watches you all the time if you're there. I was very polite and friendly and was met with a quite shocking level of negative attitude that made me feel very uncomfortable to be in the building. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Louche, dishonest and rude hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hollandreview10
Reviews.Content: You should know that I have never stayed at this hotel before. But I have had to deal with the rude staff for weeks now. What happened? I tried to book, but things went wrong on clicking the last booking button. I immediately wanted to cancel, so I called right away. They said no problem and that the money wouldn't be charged. It of course did, so I had to call them again. After about 5 different phone calls to different people who didn't speak Dutch and then some who did, they assured me I would get the money back in 2 weeks. Four weeks passed, still nothing. When I called again, they said they never give money back unless you cancel by e-mail. In the reservation e-mail, it said nothing about any cancellation e-mails. This is absolute nonsense. They also denied talking to me on the phone before. The manager had been incredible rude, even on the point of shouting to me. I would avoid this awful place at all costs, expecially after reading some of the experiences other people had, who have in fact been staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpful, rates not clear”
Reviews.Author: benjie28
Reviews.Content: I was charged 240â‚¬ (+ 50â‚¬ deposit) for not staying at this hostel, eventhough I had phoned to cancel the room, because "it's the policy, you need to cancel via email, blablabla". Reason why I wanted to cancel? Two different prices were shown on screen: prior to clicking confirm, the price was 380â‚¬ for 5 people, and once payment was processed, 480â‚¬. Normal you say? I don't think so. The staff I had over the phone was really unhelpful, thinking I was a thief trying to scam them. In the end, I know who the thieves are.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible, but not worth the hassles.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckinScotland
Reviews.Content: Annemarie had a lot of potential. We stayed in a 6 bed room with ensuite bathroom, and the room itself was fine - clean and even had a balcony. The bathroom was alright, although tiny for both a toilet and shower. However, I think we may have just lucked out with the room - friends staying at the same time in a larger, boiling hot dorm downstairs were not so happy, as they had to cross through the kitchen to get to the shower/bathroom from their room. I have no complaints about the the location - the hotel is right next to the Museumplein, as well as a supermarket and a tram stop. My main issue is with the service. This place did not have many things that I consider to be standard issue for a hostel in a major city - no lockers, for one, plus they only accept cash payment. This was a big issue for me, as I had booked four friends who were all arriving at different times, and was made to pay for all of their bookings in cash, up front. They didn't have enough key cards, and could therefore only give us two keys for our party of four. Breakfast was free, but only served til 9am and less than inspiring. Front desk staff were often clueless or downright rude. The bottom line is, in a backpacker-filled city like Amsterdam, Annemarie doesn't have a clue about how to cater to budget travelers. Choose one of the many other hostels in the city that does!

Reviews.Title: “Ok budget crash pad.”
Reviews.Author: belbox09
Reviews.Content: BAD points first. No ensuite but we knew that already. Most staff were not very helpful however one was very helpful. Shower room was like a sauna, extractor fan broken. Rooms were tiny so a twin meant 2 beds right next to each other (thats a double, right?) Ok for cleanliness & breakfast was'nt great. GOOD points. Location was very good, right next to tram line and park and a very useful supermarket across the street. Security was very good and we never had any issues with leaving food and alcohol in the shared fridge. Red light district and other attactions within easy reach via tram. You get what you pay for so if you just need a place to sleep, this place will be fine. Bedding was provided but I took a sleeping bag for comfort. Would I stay there again? maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Great City - Terrible Hostel, Stay Elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: lukiebabie
Reviews.Content: It comes as no suprise to me that this hostel has received so many bad reviews on this website as it was by far one of the worst places I have ever stayed at. I have travelled throughout Asia and stayed in many third world countries and what those places lack in comfort and quality amenities they make up for in customer service. However this hostel has neither. Like many others, when choosing a place to stay we decided to pay a bit less and just put up with one star accomodation. It proved a costly mistake, finacially and to our holiday. Firstly upon arrival you are asked to pay a series of extra cost such as deposits and taxes. I have had exactly the same experiences as some of the other reviewers here as we never got our deposit back. The reason the management gave us was that we had drinks in our room. When we asked what was wrong with that they pointed to a small sign on the other side of the door that simply read, "no drink in rooms." Even water isn't exceptable. The result of breaking this rule was $150 euro. The breakfast is a joke as some members of my group were told not to have any more toast before even having a first slice and the hostel provides five boiled eggs for everyone staying. The hostels website boasts a young a vibrant staff who are happy to cater to the needs of younger guests. This could not be further from the truth as all staff we encountered were bored, rude or completely useless; the manager being worst of all. When told we could not drink in our rooms we drank in the common area where we were constantly told to be quiet. Were we not such a determind group of travelleres this could have seriously effected our city break. However the added strain of all the extra costs and no help getting around the city leads me to urge anyone thinking about staying here to quickly look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Incompetent People and Expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: blionel3
Reviews.Content: We went (4 friends) in the 9 mixed en suite room for 4 nights... The first day, 2 beds were not free for us, so we asked the guy at the reception when they will be free.... He said no problem; it will be free for the night..... Coming back at 3am, we had the surprise to see someone sleeping in my friendâ€™s bed! So we asked another guy at the reception (totally incompetent by the way), who told my friend to sleep in the same bed as another friend, as "a favour" for him!!!! So he (my friend) had to go to another hostel (45min) walking in the middle of the night to find a place to sleep... People in this place are totally incompetent, and not very friendly... Thatâ€™s not all, itâ€™s dirty (e.g. showers) and extremely small (they put as many beds as they can in one room). Iâ€™ve been in many hostels before (Barcelona, Boston, New-York) and that was by far of very very poor standards. And itâ€™s so expensive for what it is!!!! In one sentence: GO SOMEWHERE ELSE! Trust me

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: D3n50n
Reviews.Content: I can't understand why there are bad reviews here, it's not a bad hotel at all. It is a kind of hostel where you don't need to make your own bed or wash up after breakfast. I had no problems. The breakfast was ok, the room was reasonably clean and the showers/toilets were as clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It saved me a lot of money compared to other hotels to stay in a dorm and it was easy, but I'm a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “They stole money on my credit card”
Reviews.Author: amandamara
Reviews.Content: It was really a bad experience. I booked there then two days before going there I phone them to speak about check in and they told me that unfortunately they did not record my reservation, so I went in a other hotel because they told me that there was no place left, but they still took 80â‚¬ from my credit card, saying that I did not show and there was no evidence that somebody told methat there was no place left! Unbelievable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unpolite and offensive staff”
Reviews.Author: lallel
Reviews.Content: This is a small hostel and the owner is extremely unpolite. We had some problems and had a little delay in our check out time, and for this reason he has been extremely rude and offensive, shouting, calling us with unrepeateble names, while we were under shock and not reacted. He diden't give us back the deposit and treated us like the wors of the animals, just unbelieveble.

Reviews.Title: “Ok as a hostel”
Reviews.Author: brazilianeye
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, well location, nice as a hostel, but if you are looking for hotel (it was my case) i think you can find something better with the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: TriCitizen
Reviews.Content: The beds were tiny, they pack as many people as they can into a room ( even bringing a cot into one of the rooms right next to my friend on the bottom bunk), and the bathroom was not very clean. There was another room we moved into though which had much larger beds ( the 6 bed I think) so its the luck of the draw I guess However the staff was really friendly, the house cat ( a huge ginger tabby called Ander gives the place some charm) is funny and the location is excellent for the bottom of A-Dam. The price wasnt too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: primerstar6
Reviews.Content: Offensive and rude employees, really small beds and gross bathrooms, even for a hostel. I couldn't believe this hostel was in Amsterdam, it was more like a gulag with the rules and attitudes. Seemed like they hate Americans with a passion. I did not complete my stay there, even forfeiting my money so i could enjoy my time elsewhere. I couldn't regret staying at the Annemarie more.

Reviews.Title: “Utter poo”
Reviews.Author: Carlog890
Reviews.Content: Ah, the hotel annemarie, where can i begin. We arrived and were promptly asked to pay the full week's rates upfront...in cash. When we were shown to our room several minutes later, we turned to complain to the hotel staff member, only to find a door slammed in our face. It was then that we noticed a sign on the back of the door: NO REFUNDS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. A sign on the other side of the room read STRICTLY NO HARD DRUGS. We looked around our new home. A subtle aroma hung in the air. Cigarette and joint butts littered the carpet periphery. When I made the mistake of leaning over to open the window to try and ventilate the place I noticed several used condoms (as well as other unsanitary miscellanea) squeezed between the wall and the radiator. The brown, soiled curtain was hanging off its railing, the bedsheets were diseased, the shower was one floor up. Hotel Annemarie is grim, grim I tell ya.

HotelInfo.Name: Annemarie Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Jan Willem Brouwstraat 14, Amsterdam 1071 LJ, The Netherlands
